metadata.title: CVE-2016-8615 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in curl before version 7.51. If cookie state is writteninto a cookie jar file that is later read back and used for subsequentrequests, a malicious HTTP server can inject new cookies for arbitrarydomains into said cookie jar.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-8615` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

curl - 7.47.0-1ubuntu2.2
libcurl3 - 7.47.0-1ubuntu2.2
libcurl3-gnutls - 7.47.0-1ubuntu2.2
libcurl3-nss - 7.47.0-1ubuntu2.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: curl package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7.47.0-1ubuntu2.2').
